programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack concocts a plan to regain the favor of an attractive Southern Belle he has insulted on a date.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's physical checkup for a life insurance policy has him convinced his days are numbered.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Mrs. Roper thinks her husband is having an affair when she finds his hidden stash of love letters , written to a woman named Doris.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's mother comes for a visit. But later it is revealed that she has no place to go. So Helen and her two sisters get together to decide what to do, cause none of them really want her living with them.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: James tries to match his ex-wife with a business acquaintance, hoping to cease paying her alimony.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: A change of editors at his publishing company drives Henry to work for another publisher, but the new job is in New York.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: When Muriel's friend, a recent and happy divorcee, makes an appearance at the Rush household, Muriel has some second thought about married life.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Muriel mistakenly snaps a photo of a wanted gangster and the intrigue it causes leads Henry to believe she's having an affair.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Jackie shocks the family when she announces her plan to marry a surfer she met while on vacation in Hawaii.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: For Every Man There's Two Women
programme.desc: Henry takes the law into his own hands when the police refuse to search for the two women who assaulted Monroe.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: When Henry breaks his arm, his boss hires an ambitious young cartoonist to help with his comic strip.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Fear of being robbed strikes Henry and Monroe when they find a bag containing thousands of dollars and decide not to tell anyone.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: These Stupid Things Remind Me of You
programme.desc: A series of flashbacks trace Monroe's relationship with the Rushes.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Following the death of his father, Henry agonizes over who will give the eulogy at his own funeral.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Murray is saving to buy Bannister's old car, but at five dollars a payment, it's going too slow. He gets a tip from a customer for setting him up with another customer. Bannister dresses up to help Cobb'[s get a new deal, which leads to him getting arrested for running a house of prostitution.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister is panicking when an army buddy of his escapes prison to visit him. Cobb's hold a World Record Jump Rope competition.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.sub-title: Love is a Many Splendored Alf
programme.desc: Alf puts makeup on an attractive lady shopping which leads to them going on a date. The freezers in the store blows up, and there's a mad scramble to keep the food frozen.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: The staff pose for the camera in bowling uniforms. They're trying to win a local bowling competition with a grand prize of 3,000. Edna wants to bowl, but Howard will only let her if someone else gets hurt. When their lead bowler breaks his arm, the store scrambles to find a replacement,

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: A French exchange student causes havoc with the Harper men. Nick joins a science experiment. Michael must sleep in Nick's room with interesting results.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen's luncheon makes her consider leaving the Cheviot Hills neighborhood. Stanley believes her and, without asking, has Jeffrey Brookes put their home on the market. Will The Ropers really relocate?

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen and her sisters are shocked by their elderly mother wanting to have a 'wake' for herself. She invites others to say goodbye in advance. Also, Jeffrey throws his back out and is trapped in a chair.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: It's Christmas at the Harpers, Janey comes home with a gift for the holidays, and Nick has an idea for a holiday business.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: In search of a peaceful work atmosphere, Henry mistakenly takes studio space at Wainwright Publishing.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: While Henry pushes Jackie towards marriage, she pushes her steady, Bill St. George, towards fatherhood.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe's misadventures with unemployment and workmen's compensation puts Jackie and Sara at odds with Henry.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe befriends a fifteen year old shoplifter and invites him to the Rush household.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry's plans to send Andrew to school for gifted children meet with Muriel's objection.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry misinterprets Signor Aldo's intentions and jeopardizes Jackie's opportunity to go to Italy and work for the designer.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The ever hustling Paul Deveraux begs Iris and the Rush family to pose as his own family to impress a son he never knew he had.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Monroe's mysterious new girlfriend, Linda turns out to be quite wealthy and old enough to be his mother.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Sara's whirlwind romance with a young advertising executive leaves Henry distraught.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Christian is preparing for his first vacation in years. His plane leaves in an hour but he's lingering at the store. When he learns Edna will be taking over, he has a time of relief, until he learns that her first duty will be a conference in Tokyo. He panics as it's too late to cancel his trip.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Howard stars as a Cubby Cheese Ball in a television commercial promoting Cobb's. Health food fanatics decide to protest the store but it gets out of hand. On his way to the surprise birthday party, Howard finds his entire staff bound, gagged and help hostage by the group.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: A no-frills market opens across the street and starts a price-war. Bannister is caught up in his own problems when Edna takes a vacation to rethink the relationship.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: It's the 7th anniversary of Edna and Howard's first date. Howard was busy and has Alf pick out a present for him, but instead of jewelry he brings back a hamster.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Edna has tickets for a ballet show, but Howard doesn't want to go. He then gets jealous when she takes someone else.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan wants a burglar alarm. Nick wants to become a stripper.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: As one of Susan's tour group dies unexpectedly, she decides that the family needs life insurance. Nick agrees in order to win favor with his girlfriend - an insurance salesperson!

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Ethel tries to get a china horse, supposedly from the Ming Dynasty, away from Helen.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack is in a panic - and in the doghouse with Chrissy and Janet - when a young pregnant woman arrives at the house and names him as the father.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack, Chrissy and Janet find out how far Mr. Roper's garden has gone to pot when they find some unusual plants while weeding it.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Chrissy's minister-father arrives ahead of schedule for a visit and catches Jack red-handed living with his little girl and Janet.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack and Chrissy offer to babysit for Stanley Roper's parakeet in exchange for a couple of concert tickets.
